_header: All ye mowen be blith and glad
_description: Life of Christ — 358 lines in thirteen-line stanzas rhyming ababababbcccb

BodAddC280.First Lines:
Alle ȝe mowyn be blyth & gladeþis is þe day
                    þat god madeAlle we mowyn be blyth & gladeIn blysse for to
                    bydynffor god restyd as clerkys redey set be twen ȝewre
                    sydyn…
BodAddC280.Last Lines:
…yn till vs hys blysse god bryngewher paradys hys
                    pyth
BodAddC280.Editions:
Pickering,   Oliver S. 
             “The Expository Temporale Poems of the South English Legendary.” 
             Leeds Studies in English
         n.s. 10 (1978): 1-17: 1-17.
